com.github.mikephil.charting.highlight

Class Highlight

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mikephil.charting.highlight.Highlight

  • public class Highlight
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains information needed to determine the highlighted value.
    Author:
    Philipp Jahoda

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int mDataSetIndex
      the index of the dataset the highlighted value is in
      private Range mRange
      the range of the bar that is selected (only for stacked-barchart)
      private int mStackIndex
      index which value of a stacked bar entry is highlighted, default -1
      private int mXIndex
      the x-index of the highlighted value

      returns true if this highlight object is equal to the other (compares xIndex and dataSetIndex)
      int getDataSetIndex()
      returns the index of the DataSet the highlighted value is in
      Range getRange()
      Returns the range of values the selected value of a stacked bar is in.

      • Highlight

        public Highlight(int x,
                 int dataSet,
                 int stackIndex)
        Constructor, only used for stacked-barchart.
        Parameters:
        x - the index of the highlighted value on the x-axis
        dataSet - the index of the DataSet the highlighted value belongs to
        stackIndex - references which value of a stacked-bar entry has been selected

      • Highlight

        public Highlight(int x,
                 int dataSet,
                 int stackIndex,
                 Range range)
        Constructor, only used for stacked-barchart.
        Parameters:
        x - the index of the highlighted value on the x-axis
        dataSet - the index of the DataSet the highlighted value belongs to
        stackIndex - references which value of a stacked-bar entry has been selected
        range - the range the selected stack-value is in

        public int getXIndex()
        returns the index of the highlighted value on the x-axis
        Returns:

      • getStackIndex

        public int getStackIndex()
        Only needed if a stacked-barchart entry was highlighted. References the selected value within the stacked-entry.
        Returns:

      • getRange

        public Range getRange()
        Returns the range of values the selected value of a stacked bar is in. (this is only relevant for stacked-barchart)
        Returns:
